name: ACW Circular Walk 12C (an even shorter [4 mile total] short-cut route than route A, devised for use on the WWF 7-Jun-2005 event)

ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 12C is a circular UK route, noted as a shorter 4-mile shortcut variant of Route A created for a WWF event on 7 June 2005. The documented distance is 9 km, presenting a moderate hike with varied terrain and suitable for walkers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed countryside footpaths and quiet lanes with field margins. Expect hedges, potential stiles, uneven ground, and possible mud after rain. Some sections may be shaded while others are exposed; footwear should be sturdy to handle variable surfaces.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight before setting out. Wear sturdy footwear and carry a map or GPS. Be cautious on muddy or uneven sections and at stiles or gates. Stay on public rights of way, respect livestock, and carry sufficient water, a basic first aid kit, and a charged mobile device with a way to contact help if needed.
recommended_gear: Headlamp or flashlight (optional for late finishes)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) generally offers the best conditions; winter conditions can be variable and more challenging.

seo.title: ACW Circular Walk 12C – 9 km Circular Hike (4-mile Shortcut Variant) in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore ACW Circular Walk 12C, a 9 km moderate circular hike in the UK, featuring a shortened 4-mile shortcut variant designed for a WWF event. Includes terrain, safety tips, and gear guidance.
